Articles.Content: After we revert or go to another flight, infinite fuel should automatically be disabled so we don't forget about it and ruin our next launch.

Just add more boosters

EDIT : On a more serious note, just use the lucridous tech of the most amazing space engineeres ever : the checklist. There is nothing more to it, as you will start to as for it at the end of a flight, but next time, it will be somebody else asking for the auto disable at atmosphere exit. This is a DEBUG tool, therefore, I do think demands regarding this feature are to be overlooked.

Edited June 6, 2014 by Vindelle_Sunveam

I see NO reason for this.

Just disable it once you're done with it, atleast try to remember a few things yourself without the game holding your hand.

I like that whatever debug tool you're using stays active. I use it more for hacking gravity and testing orbital ships on the ground, it would be inconvenient to have to reenable it every time I go back to the VAB to make some changes.

You'll notice infinite fuel is still on in less than a minute after launching, so you're not losing a ton of play if you have to revert because you forgot to turn it off.
